title: Complete Wagarashi Clan Tier List And Guide
description: Check out the best clans in Wagarashi and my reasons for why they are the best.
author: Gordan Perisic
excerpt: Check out the best clans in Wagarashi and my reasons for why they are the best.
text: Image by The Escapist Check out the best clans in Wagarashi and my reasons for why they are the best. | Published: May 5, 2025 11:01 am What I like about clans in Wagarashi Roblox is that rarity isn’t a determiner of whether a clan is good. There are some amazing Common clans and some mid Legendary clans. I’m here to guide you through them all to find out which are the best ones. Here’s my Wagarashi clan tier list and guide. Table of contentsAll Wagarashi Clans RankedBest Wagarashi ClansS-Tier Wagarashi ClansA-Tier Wagarashi ClansB-Tier Wagarashi ClansC-Tier Wagarashi ClansD-Tier Wagarashi ClansHow to Reroll Clans in Wagarashi All Wagarashi Clans Ranked Letter Border Colors Are Rarities – Backgrounds Are Associated Countries: Image by The Escapist I’m only going to be rating Roblox Wagarashi clans that you get from Clan Rerolls so even though Otsutsuki is SSS-Tier it won’t be on the list. Also they removed Tengoku during tests so I won’t include it for now but it would be S-Tier for sure. Lastly, note that S++, S, and A Tiers aren’t necessarily must-play but they’re just overpowered due to stuns, combo potential, and damage. B-Tier clans are really great options too, just not as OP as the higher ones. Lastly, C and D-Tier are either clans that were nerfed to the ground or clans with really weak moves. Check out the ranking reasons below. Best Wagarashi Clans ClanRarityRanking ExplanationAll MovesHyugaLegendary (Leaf Clan)Amazing combo potential and you have the best chakra management for yourself and enemies. It’s a brutal Clan and one of the best in the game. You just have to focus on close-range melee combat.• Byakugan and Tenseigan Buffs and Progression• Otsutsuki Progression• Gentle Fist Fighting Style (From skill cards)• Rotation: AOE damage spin that bounces.• Vacuum Palm: Great damage AOE line punch forward that bounces.• 64 Palms: Amazing damage 64 hit combo that stun-locks in an AOE.UchihaLegendary (Leaf Clan)• Passive: 5% Fire damage boost• Sharingan, Mangekyo Sharingan, and Eternal Mangekyo Buffs and Progression• Lions Barrage: Easy to hit kick that launches into a high damage air combo.• Kunai Assault: An easy-to-use jump escape move that shoots kunai.• Sharingan Genjutsu: One of the best stuns in the game.ChinoikeLegendary (Cloud Clan)Though you have to have their eyes active for all moves, it’s a small price to pay for almost every move exploding and bouncing you. It’s easy to fish for comboes with this clan. It’s broken for PVP.• Ketsuryugan Progression• Passive: All moves require Ketsuryugan to be active.• Blood Spikes: An insta-hit jutsu that erupts spikes from your opponent instantly dealing damage.• Exploding Human Technique: An insta-hit jutsu that explodes your opponent dealing massive damage.• Ketsuryugan Genjutsu: Stuns your opponent for 5 seconds.• Blood Dragons: Summons three blood dragons to chase down and damage your opponent.MuLegendary (Stone Clan)You might see only four moves and think it’s bad but those four moves offer amazing damage and utility. Mu just makes enemies explode and get ragdolled around and you can even stun people with Prison to set up other moves. Some of the best damage and utility in the game.• Atomic Prison: Shoot out a projectile that traps your opponent stunning them.• Prison Intrapment: Drop a delayed explosion dealing great damage when it triggers.• Particle Pulse: A high damage AOE explosion with medium range.• Particle Insertion: Barrage your opponent with a high damage stream of particle projectiles. S-Tier Wagarashi Clans ClanRarityRanking ExplanationAll MovesUzumakiLegendary (Stone Clan)• Uzumaki Progression• Passive: Huge chakra buff.• Chain Seal: Summon and shoot out a chain that roots your opponent.• Chain Trap: An AOE version of Chain Seal that targets all enemies near you.KaratachiCommon (Mist)A prime example that Clan rarity doesn’t mean squat in Wagarashi. This is one of the highest damage-over-time Clans in the game. If you can chain M1 combos with Lava moves you’ll be watching your enemy’s HP melt.• Passive: Apply burn on all Karatachi moves.• Lava Fist: Apply burn on all M1s.• Lava Ground Burst: Punch the ground in front of you dealing great damage.• Lava Bullets: Fire scorching projectiles in a line with medium range.• Lava Breath: A short range channel attack where you stand still and fire off lava projectiles in a cone in front of you. Great as a combo finisher.• Lava Floor: Create a bed of lava below you burning all who stand inside.HozukiRare (Mist Clan)This is S-Tier for two reasons. The first is because you get an invulnerability move that makes you untargetable in PVP and PVE. Two, you can zone people with an array of ranged attacks and when they get close you’re water and can’t be attacked. OP.• Hydrification: Similar to Iburi where you become invulnerable for a short period.• Water Gun: Shoot a single water projectile.• Water Rifle: Like Water Gun but you can aim better and deal more damage. Shoot with M2.• Water Machine Gun: Like Water Gun but shoot numerous projectiles in a line.• Lurking Dive: Dive into the ground becoming invulnerable and emerge in a location in front of you at medium range.SarutobiCommon (Leaf Clan)This is an S-Tier PVP Clan. I love Sarutobi because it offers so much PVP outplay potential with Hidden Ash blinds and then later you can detonate it with Fire moves. Plus, the Staff deals good damage and the Staff move are excellent.• Passive: 15% fire damage boost.• Hidden Ash: Summon ash to black out the screen and hide.• Flamethrower: A short-range fire breath channel attack.• Burning Ash: Like Hidden Ash but ignites to deal damage to everyone inside if hit by a fire move.• Staff: Summon a high damage staff to use as a melee weapon (You must equip it in your Backpack on the Weapon slot).• Monkey Sweep: A staff AOE spin move that deals great damage with great range.• Staff Barrage: A high damage staff combo that’s best used as a finisher.YukiRare (Mist Clan)Just an overpowered mix of trapping your opponent, dealing massive damage, and some great ranged and melee moves.• Passive: Hitting enemies with Yuki abilities slows them.• Demonic Ice Mirrors: Traps your opponent in a prison of ice mirrors that constantly shoot out projectiles at the trapped enemy.• Ice Eruption: Summon three ice pillars around you that damage and briefly stun your opponent.• Slamming Ice Hammer: Summon and strike with an ice hammer dealing high damage in a short melee AOE.• Piercing Ice: Summon ice projectiles around you and you can recast to shoot them when you want.SenjuRare (Leaf Clan)Senju’s not really OP like the rest of S Tier but it is a great Clan due to utility with the clone and great damage and stun potential. Also, while Wood Prison doesn’t do anything 1v1, it can be excellent to isolate multiple people if you’re getting ganked.• Passive: Massively increases your HP.• Thrusting Wood: A melee push and a decent combo finisher.• Wood Clone: Summon a melee clone to fight for you.• Tree Binding: An amazing stun-lock damage move.• Wood Prison: Creates an arena to isolate your opponents.• Wood Release: Long range damage move.LeeCommon (Leaf Clan)You get a teleport move with an M1 damage boost and great combo chainers with 7th and 8th gate. An amazing melee build and one of, if not the best melee builds in the game.• Get all 8th Gates• Passive: 8% M1 damage buff.• Speed Blitz: Become temporarily invulnerable then deliver a high damage kick.• Right Left Goodnight: A melee combo that’s great as a finisher.• Lethal Barrage: A fast high damage melee lockdown combo. A-Tier Wagarashi Clans ClanRarityRanking ExplanationAll MovesRaiLegendary (Cloud Clan)One of the fastest melee focused Clans in the game with Lightning Cloak. It also gives you damage reduction and the Stomp+Lariant combo is excellent damage.• Lightning Stomp: Enhance your next attack to be an empowered high damage stomp.• Lariant: Enhance your next attack to be a dash forward that damages the first enemy hit and throws them back.• Lightning Cloak: Get 10% damage reduction and massive movement speed. Can be taken again as an upgrade for better damage reduction but higher mana drain.AkimichiRare (Leaf Clan)An amazing blend of mobility and high damage AOE moves. Spiky Human Boulder is one of the best if not the best mobility moves in the game both for offense and escaping ganks.• Spiky Human Boulder: One of the best mobility moves in the game where you turn into a spiky ball and can sprint around fast dealing damage or escape a gank.• Barrage: A decently strong melee damage combo that’s best used as a ground finisher.• Butterfly Wings: Gain a buff to all stats and speed with a dash trail at the cost of constant chakra drain.• Double Arm Slam: Short range melee slam for combos.• Heavy Body Slam: Jump up and dash towards your opponent slamming down and stunning them.IburiRare (Sand Clan)A slightly weaker Hozuki because you lack ranged moves but still great because you get to be invulnerable for a few seconds. Plus, your moves disable enemy M1s and Blocks giving you plenty of time to be aggressive.• Passive: When you hit with Iburi damage skills, they apply a debuff that disables enemy M1s and Blocks.• Steam Body: Similar to Hozuki as it makes you invulnerable for a short period.• Steam Geiser: A melee knock up into a medium damage slam.• Steam Release: A quick AOE steam pulse that applies your Passive.• Geiser Barrage: An AOE medium damage jutsu that’s mostly used to apply the Passive.HoukiLegendary (Sand Clan)Only A-Tier if you combine it with Wind jutsu and always have the Fan equipped. You can deal some great damage and zone enemies only to dish out some great melee damage with X Spec. But if you’re not using Wind it falls off.• Passive: 20% Wind damage boost.• Houki Fan: Summon a massive fan weapon that must be equipped.• X Spec: With the fan equipped, imbue the fan with Wind to deal even greater damage.• Triple Tornados: With the fan equipped, summon three tornadoes that shoot forward in a wide line with long range dealing great damage.• Devastating Winds: With the fan equipped, perform a high damage melee slash. Great as a combo finisher.HoshigakiLegendary (Mist Clan)This is by itself a powerful Clan but you really need water to make it work since it empowers moves and regenerates your chakra. So if you are fighting in water or have a Suzumura ally to summon Water Pools, this is S-Tier.• Passive: Regenerate chakra while walking on water.• Passive 2: 6% Water damage boost.• Seeking Sharks: Summon a shark projectile to strike your opponent from above. Summons more if you’re in water.• Water Wave: Summon and shoot a wide wave that goes in a line and knocks up and damages enemies.• Water Pool: Summons a body of water around you giving you your Passive and extra effects on other jutsus.• Shark Blast: Shoots shark projectiles straight in a line in front of you dealing medium damage.• Dive: If you’re on a body of water or your Water Pool dive in becoming faster and invulnerable. AkafuraRare (Stone Clan)This would be S-Tier if the S-Tier wasn’t filled with OP stuff but Akafura has an amazing line up of HIGH damage moves. And you get a lot of them with great utility and mobility with Clones and Double Exploding Palm.• Explosive Palm: A melee attack that explodes dealing high damage. Great combo finisher.• Explosive Clone: Summon a clone that doesn’t attack but rushes to your opponent and explodes dealing AOE damage.• Double Exploding Palm: Dash forward in the direction of your cursor.• Repulsive Kick: Dash forward with great speed and kick your opponent air-borne.• Triple Explosions: Send a line of explosions away from you with long range and great damage.KamizuruRare (Stone Clan)Kamizuru is one of the best clans in the game for zoning out your opponent and kiting them. Not only do your skills slow but you can also place turrets and prepare bee projectiles. Your strength lies in preparing yourself with your jutsus so don’t just run in blindly and hope for the best.• Passive: Your Kamizuru skills apply a slowing effect.• Bee Release: Send a bee to your opponent dealing low damage.• Bee Barrage: Summon a swarm of bees around you and you can reactive the skill to shoot them forward. • Hive: Drop a hive of bees that acts like a turret attacking nearby enemies.• Homing Hive: Summon three hovering Hives around you and you can reactive the skill to launch them at your opponent.• Bee Torment: Summons massive bees to shoot at your opponent.SuzumuraCommon (Mist Clan)Just an excellent zoning Clan with Bubble Field since you can drop it and then spam all the ranged moves and your opponent can either approach and take damage or stay back as your cooldowns recharge.• Bubble Burst: Fire a series of bubble projectiles towards your cursor dealing low damage but great stun.• Bubble Field: Summon numerous bubbles in a wide area around you. If an enemy touches these bubbles they explode dealing damage and stunning briefly.• Water Pool: Summon a body of water. Comboes great if you have a friend who’s playing Hoshigaki.• Bubble Swamp: Summon a massive bubble in front of you dealing great damage and bouncing your opponent.• Bubble Assault: Like Bubble Swamp but summon multiple bubbles around you.• Sealed Bubble: A melee grab attack that traps your opponent in a bubble prison dealing great damage and stunning them. B-Tier Wagarashi Clans ClanRarityRanking ExplanationAll MovesOribeCommon (Sand)Really good for PVE but for PVP it’s not the best since most of the moves can be easily dodged. That said, I really love the Aerial Shots because you can reposition or escape a sticky situation and counter attack. • Scorch Orbs: Summon three orbs around you that deal damage on contact.• Scorch Orb Barrage: Launch three orbs in front of you dealing medium damage.• Scorch Homing Orb: A homing ranged attack that deals medium damage.• Aerial Shots: Jump into the air and shoot Scorch orbs toward your cursor.KaguyaCommon (Stone Clan)The definition of mid because you have strong zoning moves with Bone Field and Dance and are focused on melee. You’ll often be outranged by other stronger Clans but if you can get in close you can do decent damage with Bone Sword.• Bone Shrapnel: Shoot a low damage projectile.• Bone Guard: Surround yourself in bony spikes enhancing your melee combat.• Bone Sword: Summon a bone sword that’s equipable and deals great damage. • Bone Field: Summon spikes from the ground around you striking in random locations for medium damage.• Bracken Dance: Like Bone Field but summons spikes in front of you.• Piercing Bone: Summon and throw a bone spear dealing high damage and stunning your target.MiyajimaCommon (Stone Clan)Similar to Kaguya but worse. Though you do have some better defenses in exchange for chakra drain with Crystal Armor.• Crystal Blade: Summon a crystal blade that you can equip.• Crystal Prison: A short range stun attack with a short duration.• Crystal Release: Shoot out crystal spikes in a line across a short range.• Crystal Armor: Gain 20% damage reduction.YotsukiRare (Cloud Clan)Better than Hatake by far and I prefer it over Kaguya and Miyajima because it has more range and zoning potential.• Yotsuki Progression • Passive: 5% Lightning damage boost.• Laser Charging Barrage: Summon lightning projectiles in the air around you that keep shooting your opponent.• Laser Circus: A short range melee attack that’s great as a combo finisher.• Laser Volley: Similar to LCB but summons one portal that barrages your opponent with high damage shots.NamikazeLegendary (Sand)This was my first starting Clan and my first main. The moves sound amazing but the issue is that they’re a little clunky and buggy and often the Rasengan doesn’t work well with the Raijin Kunai Throw. So could be higher like A or S if it worked but as it is it sucks.• Raijin Kunai: Summon a special high-damage Kunai weapon that you must equip.• Raijin Kunai Throw: Throw the Raijin Kunai and teleport to the first target hit.• Raijin Strikes: Dash around your opponent and strike them in random spots while being invulnerable.Rasengan: Summon a Rasengan which deals high damage to anyone you physically come into contact with. Can be a combo with Raijin Kunai Throw for a special variation. C-Tier Wagarashi Clans ClanRarityRanking ExplanationAll MovesAburameCommon (Cloud Clan)Not the best clan since you only have 2 damage moves but those moves are pretty decent. The Beetle Armor is nice but the chakra drain has to be managed.• Beetle Prison: Summon a medium range AOE that blasts your opponent with insects and continues to deal damage after the explosion.• Beetles Impact: A forward blast attack.• Beetle Armor: Gain damage reduction with chakra drain.KazesunaRare (Sand Clan)While it has plenty of moves most of them are bad either due to low damage or you are left exposed. Sand Trap is easily jumped over and airdashed leaving you exposed. The only good moves are Sand Armor with Diamond Sand and Sand Coffin if you can hit it but otherwise this is one of the worst Rares in the game. It can be okay for PVE but in PVP it sucks when playing against skilled opponents.• Passive: You either get Iron Sand which procs Lightning on moves or you get Diamond Sand which buffs the Sand Armor jutsu for even more tankyness.• Sand Trap: Perform an AOE damage ground move but you have to stand still and channel.• Sandy Surge: Similar to Sand Trap but this AOE damage move targets enemies in the air as well.• Sand Spikes: A clunky short range AOE melee strike that leaves you exposed like Sand Trap.• Sand Slash: A slow moving short range projectile of sand dealing low damage.• Sand Coffin: A ranged grab attack that deals medium damage.• Rising Dunes: Project a line of exploding sand dunes launching enemies in the air and dealing medium damage.• Sand Armor: Give yourself 20% damage reduction or higher with Diamond Sand. D-Tier Wagarashi Clans ClanRarityRanking ExplanationAll MovesHatakeRare (Cloud Clan)The Progression Quest for Lightning damage boost is really good but the Clan just has 2 moves that are dumpster tier. Could be C-Tier with a heavy lightning focus with the progression but otherwise it’s trash.• Hatake Progression for 25% more Lightning damage boost• Passive: 5% Lightning damage boost.• Triple Lightning Strike: Summon a wide medium damage lightning strike that’s difficult to dodge sideways but easy to dodge backwards or forwards.• Striking Impact: A short range melee attack that pushes your opponent.InuzukaRare (Stone Clan)This is the worst clan in the game so I would just reroll or wipe.• Passive: Highlight players in different colors for a better overview of where they are.• Raging Leap: A slow channel leap that deals low damage and doesn’t send you high in the air.• Slashing Combo: A quick melee slash attack combo dealing medium damage. How to Reroll Clans in Wagarashi Image by The Escapist You can change your Wagarashi Clan with Clan Rerolls and there are two ways to get those: Shop: But a Clan Reroll from the Shop for 199 Robux. I don’t recommend this option at all since it’s too expensive and there are a lot of bad Clans as you can see above. Codes: Check out our Wagarashi Codes for free Clan Rerolls for the best way to change your clan. Note that Clan Rerolls automatically change your Clan as soon as you input them so make sure you’re ready before using the Code. You’ll also lose anything in your hotbar 1-9 if it’s not in your Inventory bag so put everything there first like Mythical Scrolls before using a Clan Reroll. That’s it for my full Wagarashi Clan Tier List. Stay tuned to our Roblox guides page for more Wagarashi guides. The Escapist is supported by our audience. html:
Image by The Escapist

Check out the best clans in Wagarashi and my reasons for why they are the best.

|

Published: May 5, 2025 11:01 am

What I like about clans in Wagarashi Roblox is that rarity isn’t a determiner of whether a clan is good. There are some amazing Common clans and some mid Legendary clans. I’m here to guide you through them all to find out which are the best ones. Here’s my Wagarashi clan tier list and guide.

Table of contents

  • All Wagarashi Clans Ranked
    • Best Wagarashi Clans
    • S-Tier Wagarashi Clans
    • A-Tier Wagarashi Clans
    • B-Tier Wagarashi Clans
    • C-Tier Wagarashi Clans
    • D-Tier Wagarashi Clans
  • How to Reroll Clans in Wagarashi

All Wagarashi Clans Ranked

I’m only going to be rating Roblox Wagarashi clans that you get from Clan Rerolls so even though Otsutsuki is SSS-Tier it won’t be on the list. Also they removed Tengoku during tests so I won’t include it for now but it would be S-Tier for sure. Lastly, note that S++, S, and A Tiers aren’t necessarily must-play but they’re just overpowered due to stuns, combo potential, and damage. B-Tier clans are really great options too, just not as OP as the higher ones. Lastly, C and D-Tier are either clans that were nerfed to the ground or clans with really weak moves. Check out the ranking reasons below.

Best Wagarashi Clans

S-Tier Wagarashi Clans

A-Tier Wagarashi Clans

B-Tier Wagarashi Clans

C-Tier Wagarashi Clans

D-Tier Wagarashi Clans

How to Reroll Clans in Wagarashi

You can change your Wagarashi Clan with Clan Rerolls and there are two ways to get those:

  • Shop: But a Clan Reroll from the Shop for 199 Robux. I don’t recommend this option at all since it’s too expensive and there are a lot of bad Clans as you can see above.
  • Codes: Check out our Wagarashi Codes for free Clan Rerolls for the best way to change your clan. Note that Clan Rerolls automatically change your Clan as soon as you input them so make sure you’re ready before using the Code. You’ll also lose anything in your hotbar 1-9 if it’s not in your Inventory bag so put everything there first like Mythical Scrolls before using a Clan Reroll.

That’s it for my full Wagarashi Clan Tier List. Stay tuned to our Roblox guides page for more Wagarashi guides.
